column4: I have a partition question for you:  I have 3 partitions on a 20 gig harddrive, a 7 gig /, 10 gig /home, and 1 gig swap.  I want to merge the / and /home partitions to be one single /, is there a way to do that without destroying / ??  I can destroy /home (backup on another harddrive)
oh, I guess one more question about the partition thing, after I delete /home and expand /, do I just copy /home to the / ??
/home will be gone after you delete it.
Are they setup like that?  / /home swap?
then yeah, you can just delete /home and expand /.  You'll need a liveCD
eh?  Inside of the / partition, you'l need to copy your /home stuff
yeah, so I don't just boot LiveCD, delete /home, expand /, reboot.  Before I reboot, I copy the backup of /home to the now expanded / right?
Wrong order.  You mount both, copy /homes partition contents into /s partition (in the folder /home) then delete /home and expand /.
Once you've deleted /home (the partition), there won't be any data to copy
ah, copy your backup, yeah.  Therell be a folder /home inside of that partition, put the stuff you backed up inside of there.  And you'll need to delete the /home line in your fstab too.
delete /home in fstab ??  lost me there
in a file, /etc/fstab, it tells your computer what to mount where.  You'll need to remove the /home one, since you no longer have a home partition
